meanings.definition: To make something conform to a standard.
meanings.sent1: The company is standardizing its procedures to ensure consistency.
meanings.sent2: She is standardizing the font sizes across all documents.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about standardizing the size of all meatballs to make them look like tiny planets.
meanings.sent4: By standardizing the measurements, we can guarantee a perfect fit every time.
meanings.sent5: Standardizing the color scheme will make the website more visually appealing.

meanings.definition: To establish a standard for something.
meanings.sent1: The committee is standardizing the testing process for fairness.
meanings.sent2: He wants to standardize the quality control measures in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to standardize the rules for their game of tag to avoid arguments.
meanings.sent4: Standardizing the guidelines will help everyone understand the expectations clearly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher is standardizing the grading system to be more transparent.

meanings.definition: To bring something into conformity with a standard.
meanings.sent1: The team is standardizing the software to meet industry requirements.
meanings.sent2: They are standardizing the safety protocols to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: The artist is standardizing the brush strokes to create a unique painting style.
meanings.sent4: Standardizing the procedures will streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent5: By standardizing the ingredients, the chef ensures consistent flavor in every dish.
